title: 'Where are you really from?': Ngozi Fulani says Buckingham Palace honorary aide questioned her heritage
description: CNN's Isa Soares speaks to Ngozi Fulani after she was questioned about whether she was really British at a royal reception. The woman has been identified as an honorary member of Buckingham Palace, Lady Susan Hussey. Hussey, who served as the late Queen Elizabeth II's lady in waiting for more than 60 years and is a godmother to the Prince of Wales, has resigned and apologized, according to Buckingham Palace.

title: Russian units appear to make some progress near Bakhmut, but suffer heavy casualties
'I felt like I lost control of my life': Protester tells CNN why he spoke out
description: CNN's Selina Wang speaks with a protester in China about why he took the risk to speak out against China's zero-Covid policy.

title: The ruling removes a major obstacle to the DOJ's investigation into the mishandling of government records from Trump's time in office
description: In a major defeat for former President Donald Trump, a federal appeals court on Thursday halted a third-party review of documents seized from his Mar-a-Lago estate.

title: Mar-a-Lago special master review halted in major defeat for Trump
Hillary Clinton says US should not engage in nuclear talks with Iran as protestors stand up 'to their oppressors'
description: The US should not be negotiating with Iran "on anything right now," including a nuclear agreement, former US Secretary of State Hillary Clinton said Thursday.

title: Federal judge orders top lawyers from Trump White House to testify in criminal grand jury probe
description: A federal judge has ordered former top Trump White House lawyers to provide additional grand jury testimony, rejecting former President Donald Trump's privilege claims in the Justice Department's criminal investigation of his effort to overturn the 2020 election, people briefed on the matter said.

title: Kanye West is no longer acquiring Parler, company says
description: The rapper formerly known as Kanye West will no longer be acquiring Parler, the alternative social media platform favored by conservatives including some far-right extremists, the company announced on Thursday. West has legally changed his name to Ye.

title: 'I hold China accountable': Uyghur families demand answers over fire that triggered protests
description: For more than five years, Sharapat Mohamad Ali and her brother Mohamad had been unable to contact their family in far western China, where the government has been accused of incarcerating up to 2 million Uyghur Muslims and other ethnic minorities in internment camps.

title: Kremlin says it will not engage with US on prisoner swap talks before end of year
description: The Kremlin said on Thursday that any details of prisoner swap discussions with the United States will not be publicly disclosed and that Moscow is not planning to engage with the Biden administration before the end of the year, according to Russian state media.

title: Watch Colbert press Yellen on Fed 'conspiracy theories'
description: While appearing on "The Late Show with Stephen Colbert", US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen confronts conspiracy theories about the Fed and talks adding her signature to US currency.

title: Elon Musk vs. Tim Cook, Sam Bankman-Fried's media apology tour, and why shopping on Amazon is getting worse
description: Crypto detective "Coffeezilla" tells Nightcap's Jon Sarlin that somebody at FTX "criminally screwed up." Plus, The Washington Post's Geoffrey Fowler on how Amazon risks turning customers off by showing so many ads in search results. And CNN's Clare Duffy has the latest on the spat between Elon Musk and Tim Cook. To get the day's business headlines sent directly to your inbox, sign up for the Nightcap newsletter.

title: HIV vaccine candidate induces immune response in early clinical trial
Webb telescope spies clouds beneath the thick haze of Saturn's moon Titan
description: The James Webb Space Telescope has spied clouds on one of the solar system's most intriguing moons.

title: World No. 2 Belgium knocked out of World Cup after goalless draw with Croatia
Hillary Rodham Clinton: US should not be negotiating with Iran on anything right now
description: At a summit on women's rights at the Clinton Center in Little Rock, Clinton weighs in on US-Iran relations, Russia's barbarity and Arkansas abortion rights.

title: Hall of Famer and two-time Cy Young winner Gaylord Perry dead at age 84
description: Baseball Hall of Famer and two-time Cy Young award winner Gaylord Perry has died at age 84.

title: Christine McVie's music: 5 songs to listen to in her honor
description: There's a reason why Christine McVie was considered the heart of Fleetwood Mac.

title: FTX founder 'vaguely aware' of lending customer funds to hedge fund
description: In an interview with "Good Morning America," FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried said he was "vaguely aware" that FTX lent customers' funds to its sister firm, Alameda Research.

title: US and France are united against Russia's 'brutal war,' Biden says, as he welcomed the French president to the White House
Does the British monarchy have a racism problem?
description: Britain's royal hierarchy has changed dramatically in the past several weeks, after King Charles III became the country's first new monarch for seven decades and several of his relatives stepped into new roles.

title: Inside Christine McVie's and Stevie Nicks' decades-long friendship
description: Throughout the various personal turmoils for which the members of Fleetwood Mac are known, one relationship buoyed the band for decades: the friendship between its two frontwomen, Christine McVie and Stevie Nicks.

title: Morocco tops Group F as Croatia and Belgium play out scoreless draw
Macron: Russia's war in Ukraine means US and France 'need to become brothers in arms' once more
World No. 2 Belgium knocked out of World Cup after goalless draw with Croatia
description: Belgium was knocked out of the 2022 World Cup on Thursday after a goalless draw with Croatia left it third in Group F.

title: New footage shows Mauna Loa eruption as lava approaches highway
description: The world's largest active volcano continues to spew lava, threatening a crucial road that connects Hawaii's Big Island.

title: 5,000 years ago in what's now Spain, an owl engraved on slate could have been the hottest toy
description: Over the past century, thousands of pieces of slate engraved with images of owls have been unearthed from tombs and pits across the Iberian Peninsula, in what's now Portugal and Spain.

title: Scientists create 'baby' wormhole as sci-fi moves closer to fact
description: In science fiction -- think films and TV like "Interstellar" and "Star Trek" -- wormholes in the cosmos serve as portals through space and time for spacecraft to traverse unimaginable distances with ease. If only it were that simple.

title: House Democrats set to discuss how to handle Trump's tax returns
description: The Democratic-led House Ways and Means Committee will meet Thursday to discuss how to handle six years of former President Donald Trump's federal tax returns, one day after the panel received access to the records following a protracted legal fight.

title: How poor sleep can make you combative and what to do about it
description: Holiday stress. Work problems. Money concerns. Family issues — the worries that can keep you up at night are infinite. Develop a sleep debt from those worries, and you'll pay a price in your ability to think, plan and manage your emotions.

title: Morocco doubles its lead over Canada with second goal
New footage reveals how 5 lions escaped their Sydney zoo enclosure
description: The Great Escape always brings prisoner-of-war Steve McQueen to mind, but perhaps the real masters of breaking out are five lions who absconded from their enclosure at a Sydney zoo last month.

title: This is what McDonald's drive-thru of the future could look like
description: McDonald's is hoping a drive-thru lane with a food conveyor belt, a pickup room for delivery workers and a shelf where people can grab their orders will make life easier for customers on the go.

title: Iranian security forces kill anti-government protester celebrating World Cup defeat, rights group says
description: A man is reported to have been killed by security forces in northern Iran during public celebrations by anti-government protesters following the national football team's defeat against the United States on Tuesday.

title: January 6 committee member says entirety of panel's work will be released in coming weeks
description: A Democratic member of the House select committee investigating the January 6, 2021, Capitol riot told CNN on Thursday that the panel's work will be released in its entirety later this month so Republicans cannot cherry-pick evidence when they take over the majority.

title: We could end HIV sooner than we think. Here's how
See McCarthy's stark warning to GOP if he isn't voted House Speaker
description: CNN political analyst Jonathan Martin reacts to House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy warning House Republicans to back his bid for House Speaker and predicts what could happen if he loses.

title: Jason David Frank's cause of death revealed by his wife
description: Jason David Frank's wife has confirmed that the "Power Rangers" star's death was a result of suicide.

title: As Russia struggles in Ukraine, repression mounts at home
First on CNN: Jim Jordan renews requests to 4 current and former government officials for information and interviews as House Judiciary investigations take shape
description: GOP Rep. Jim Jordan of Ohio is sending a renewed set of requests to four current and former government officials on Thursday, providing a window into how the highest-ranking Republican on the House Judiciary Committee is zeroing in on his first top targets ahead of the next Congress when he obtains subpoena power.

title: Pepsi wants you to drink soda mixed with milk this holiday season
description: 'Tis the season to mix milk into your soda. According to Pepsi, anyway.

title: New report reveals what then-President Bush knew leading up to 9/11 attack
description: Newly released documents from April of 2004 reveal then-President George W. Bush pushed back against knowing about a domestic terror threat prior to the September 11 attack and the notion that his administration could have prevented it from happening. CNN's Tom Foreman reports.

title: South African president Cyril Ramaphosa facing impeachment calls
description: South African president Cyril Ramaphosa is facing calls to step down from opposition leaders and even senior figures in his ruling African National Congress party after an independent panel found there is initial evidence that he could have violated his oath of office.

title: The lost meaning of 'gaslighting' is an alarm bell, constantly ringing
description: Merriam-Webster has named "gaslighting" its word of the year.

title: 'Harry & Meghan' docuseries trailer debuts
description: Get ready for a more intimate look into the lives of the Duke and Duchess of Sussex.

title: 'Love Actually' director feels 'a bit stupid' about movie's lack of diversity
description: Every year, as the days grow colder and Christmas draws nearer, "Love Actually" quickly becomes a festive favorite on people's television screens.

title: Powell revives hopes of a Fed pivot. That's a bad thing
description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell made investors very happy on Wednesday. US stocks popped after the central banker gave a speech strongly indicating that the Fed would ease the historically-high pace of interest rate rises at its next policy meeting in December.

title: Macron heads to the White House for first state visit of the Biden administration
Spain boosts security as prime minister targeted amid series of letter bombs
description: Spain said Thursday it was boosting security measures after a series of letter bombs was discovered in the country, including one that was sent to Spain's prime minister last week.

title: Organ donations rise during major motorcycle rallies due to crashes, study says
description: Organ donations and transplantations increase during major US motorcycle rallies due to crashes, according to a new study, signaling a need for increased safety measures.

title: The Bidens' first state dinner features butter-poached lobster with a side of hospitality
description: President Joe Biden is hosting French President Emmanuel Macron at the White House on Thursday, using the very first state dinner of his presidency to shore up relations with a key American ally whose friendship has until recently been on the rocks.

title: Airbus reveals plans for hydrogen fuel cell aircraft
description: Airbus has announced it is developing a hydrogen-powered fuel cell engine -- and that it plans to test it on the largest commercial airplane ever to take to the skies.

title: We have the tools to fight HIV. We just need to use them
description: The long fight to end HIV/AIDS has seen real progress spurred by innovative research, prevention, treatment and education. But our nation's ambitious goal of ending the HIV epidemic by 2030 is nevertheless in peril.

title: Lava from Mauna Loa is less than 4 miles from a key highway. Officials say they have a plan in case the road closes
description: With the Mauna Loa volcano continuing to erupt on Hawaii's Big Island, local officials and residents are keeping an eye on the lava flow as it creeps closer to a major roadway and making plans for the possibility that access to the highway could soon be cut off and have a major impact on daily life.

title: CNN anchor explains what is overshadowing Will and Kate's US visit
description: The Prince and Princess of Wales are in Boston to attend the Earthshot Prize Awards. The trip, however, is overshadowed by controversy at Buckingham Palace after an aide resigned following what the palace called "unacceptable and deeply regrettable" remarks to a Black executive. CNN's Max Foster reports.

title: Paul Whelan, American detained in Russia, reportedly moved to prison hospital and unable to call home
Devin Booker goes for 51 in three quarters as the Phoenix Suns cruise to 132-113 win over the Chicago Bulls
description: Phoenix guard Devin Booker scored an astonishing 51 points in just three quarters as the Suns dominated the Chicago Bulls 132-113.

title: Binance still has big growth plans despite crypto market meltdown
description: Binance is expanding into new markets even as the crypto industry grapples with turmoil unleashed by the spectacular collapse of crypto exchange FTX.

title: China signals it could soften its zero-Covid policy, but there are more questions than answers
6 myths that might be keeping you from living your best organized life
description: If you're often running late to work because you can't find your keys or tensing at the sight of kitchen clutter, you might feel the need to get organized. But what if you don't know where to start?

title: Russian shelling leaves Kherson without power, Ukrainian official says
What's happening in China after zero-Covid protests? Here's what you need to know
description: After unprecedented protests swept China, several cities have taken steps to ease some Covid-19 restrictions and a top official has signaled a softer approach to virus controls -- leading to speculation that an end to zero-Covid may be in sight.

title: Ohio governor says guilty verdict in 2016 family massacre 'brings us one step closer to achieving justice'
description: An Ohio man accused along with his family members the 2016 massacre of another family was found guilty of multiple murder charges Wednesday.

title: Mexican boxer Canelo Álvarez apologizes to Lionel Messi: 'Every day we learn something new'
description: Mexican boxer Saul 'Canelo' Álvarez has apologized to Lionel Messi, who he previously accused of disrespecting Mexico.

title: Killings of 4 University of Idaho students may not have been the result of a targeted attack, officials now say
description: As a campus community gathered Wednesday to pay their respects for four University of Idaho students killed on November 13, officials clarified additional details in their investigation to find the culprit responsible for their deaths.

title: Philippines will explore for oil in South China Sea even without a deal with Beijing: Marcos
description: The Philippines must find a way to explore for oil and gas in the South China Sea even without a deal with China, President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said on Thursday, emphasizing his country's right to exploit energy reserves in the contested waterway.

title: India on track for record $100 billion in remittances, says World Bank
description: The extensive Indian diaspora will help the South Asian country reach a special milestone this year.

title: These are the world's most expensive cities to live in 2022
description: It seems like every month when household bills come due, we grumble about how the cost of living has gone up again.

title: As Russia struggles in Ukraine, repression mounts at home
description: A new expanded law on "foreign agents" in Russia comes into force Thursday, signifying an intensifying crackdown on free speech and opposition under President Vladimir Putin that has accelerated as his fortunes in Ukraine have deteriorated.

title: Analysis: Putin's winter of inhumanity takes Ukraine war and US aid to a new level
description: By bombing the power grid meant to sustain Ukrainians through dark, cold months, Vladimir Putin is inflicting some of the most barbaric wartime conditions experienced by civilians in Europe for decades.

title: Students sue Yale University, alleging discrimination against students with mental health disabilities
description: Current students and an advocacy group are suing Yale University and its governing body, alleging "systemic discrimination against students with mental health disabilities," according to a lawsuit filed in Connecticut federal court Wednesday.

title: McCarthy demands January 6 committee preserve all records and vows to hold hearings next year
description: House Republican Leader Kevin McCarthy sent a letter to the House select committee investigating January 6, 2021, on Wednesday demanding that it preserve all records and transcripts and vowing to hold hearings next year on the security failures that led to the US Capitol breach.

title: 'River of blood': Foxconn employee describes violent protests in China
description: Video obtained by CNN shows violence in China at Foxconn, the world's largest iPhone factory. Workers are protesting unfair treatment, dirty living conditions, and chaotic Covid rules, as CNN's Selina Wang reports.

title: House committee receives Trump's federal tax returns. Here's what they could reveal
description: The House Ways and Means Committee now has six years of Donald Trump's federal tax returns. CNN's John Berman speaks with Trump biographer David Cay Johnston about what they could reveal about the former president.

title: Who is the wealthiest person at Art Basel? This ATM machine is displaying users' bank balances for all to see
description: After cutting up a $30,000 Damien Hirst print, getting into a (now settled) legal entanglement with Nike over custom Satan sneakers and sending Grimes to the Met Gala with a sword made from melted-down guns, Brooklyn art collective MSCHF is now daring the wealthiest attendees of Art Basel Miami Beach to reveal themselves.

title: 'Let them live there': Russia claims harsh anti-LGBTQ law is defense against US influence
description: Russia's upper house of parliament unanimously voted to toughen a controversial law banning what the bill describes as LGBTQ "propaganda," making it apply to Russians of all ages. CNN's Fred Pleitgen reports.

title: Hear the promises Stewart Rhodes made to his lawyers before Oath Keepers trial
description: Oath Keepers leader Stewart Rhodes' lawyers James Lee Bright and Phillip Linder discuss the trial and seditious conspiracy conviction for their client's role in the January 6th attack on the Capitol.

title: January 6 committee to discuss potential criminal
description: As the House select committee investigating the January 6, 2021, US Capitol attack stares down a fast-approaching deadline to complete its work, members are scheduled to have a key meeting on Friday to discuss its final report as well as the possibility of making criminal referrals, multiple sources tell CNN.

title: Stéphanie Frappart to make history as the first woman to referee a men's World Cup match
Australia stuns Denmark to reach World Cup knockout stages
RSV, flu and colds: How to tell when your child is too sick for school
description: A sniffle, a sneeze or a cough can set off alarm bells these days for families with young children.

title: Stunning images of nature shortlisted for Wildlife Photographer of the Year People's Choice Award
description: A playful polar bear cub, two nuzzling red foxes and golden snub-nosed monkeys huddled together are among the shortlisted images for the Wildlife Photographer of the Year People's Choice Award 2022.
